intro: Canthium hebecladum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an erect shrub with rough, hairy stems. The plant features palmate leaves that are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, rugged appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, showy inflorescences, often with white or pale yellow petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
